comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111102223350

Steps to reproduce:

When I click on the + to open the drop down display and view my individual lots, I see the loading indicator working but, then the + changes to - and there is no display. This problem does not occur in FF 7.01. I am running FF8 beta6 on a WIN 7, 64 bit machine. Pleasae fix this for the final release or it's back to FF 7.01.


Actual results:

When I click on the + to open the drop down display and view my individual lots, I see the loading indicator working but, then the + changes to - and there is no display. This problem does not occur in FF 7.01. I am running FF8 beta5 on a WIN 7, 64 bit machine. Pleasae fix this for the final release or it's back to FF 7.01.


Expected results:

When I click on the + to open the drop down display and view my individual lots, I see the loading indicator working but, then the + changes to - and there is no display. This problem does not occur in FF 7.01. I am running FF8 beta5 on a WIN 7, 64 bit machine. Pleasae fix this for the final release or it's back to FF 7.01.
comments.creator: pepegot1@yahoo.com
comments.author: pepegot1@yahoo.com

On which site are you seeing this problem?
Which keyboard layout are you using? (is + and - in a shifted position?)

On which site are you seeing this problem?

comments.raw_text:
Thanks for your quick reply.

When I am in my Scottrade account there is + button, on the screen, not the keyboard, that should open up for a specific stock and reveal all the sub lots pertaining to that stock.  In FF 7.01 - no problem. In FF 8 beta6, the screen says "loading" but, no sub lots are revealed and the + button, on the screen turns to - .   
Scottrade.com is the where the URL is https://trading.scottrade.com/myaccount/TaxCenter.aspx
comments.creator: pepegot1@yahoo.com
comments.author: pepegot1@yahoo.com

comments.raw_text:
I rigged this up to show you as best I could: 


+  CHN 	China Fd Inc 

 +   EEM 	Ishares Msci Emerging Mkt Index 

 +   EWS	Ishares Inc Msci Singapore 

 +  EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Korea 

  + EWZ 	Ishares Inc Brazil Index Fd 

When you hit the + the following sub lots should appear but, does not:

CHN	China Fd Inc 
CHN	China Fd Inc 
CHN	China Fd Inc 
CHN	China Fd Inc 

EEM	Ishares Msci Emerging Mkt Index 
EEM	Ishares Msci Emerging Mkt Index 
EEM	Ishares Msci Emerging Mkt Index 
EEM	Ishares Msci Emerging Mkt Index 
EEM	Ishares Msci Emerging Mkt Index 

EWS	Ishares Inc Msci Singapore 
EWS	Ishares Inc Msci Singapore 

EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 
EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 
EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 
EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 
EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 
EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 
EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 
EWY	Ishares Inc Msci South Kore 

EWZ  	Ishares Inc Brazil Index Fd 
EWZ        Ishares Inc Brazil Index Fd 
 
This is what appears instead:
- CHN
-EMM
-EWS
-EWY
-EWZ
That's the problem. I hope you can fix it.

comments.raw_text:
Since you're a customer, I would suggest that you report the problem to the
support desk at scottrade.com

There's not much we can do here without an account to analyze the problem
first hand.  Do you see any error messages in Firefox's Error Console
when loading the page or when clicking on the +/- buttons?
(Tools->Web Developer->Error Console)
comments.creator: MatsPalmgren_bugz@use.startmail.com

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Joseph Gotsens from comment #7)
> Yes, there are errors in the error console but, how can I get them to you?

Save them to a text file and upload it to this bug using the "Add an attachment" link.

> I would like to clear the Error Console and then go to the Scottrade site to
> see what happens. How can I clear the Error Console?

There's a Clear button in the Error Console toolbar, click it before loading the page.

(In reply to Joseph Gotsens from comment #8)
> Actually, there are tons of warnings well over 100

Yeah, most of them are likely irrelevant warnings.  Please upload the list you get
from loading the page and clicking the +/- buttons.
comments.creator: MatsPalmgren_bugz@use.startmail.com

Can you take screenshots of Fx7 and Fx8 and upload them here? (use the
"Add an attachment" link).  You can crop them to the region where the problem
occurs to avoid revealing any sensitive data.

I wonder if Java is used for displaying this data - if you turn off Java in Fx7
(and restart) does the site still work normally after that?
<http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/How%20to%20turn%20off%20Java%20applets>
